svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Doors, Buzzers and Latches
svcsubproc.para: The side and/or rear emergency exits should be inspected daily for proper operation, as stated on the instruction decal. The door buzzer / alarm should be checked with the ignition switch in the "ON" position. If the door buzzer sounds after the door has been closed, check the door switch adjustment and electrical installation to determine the cause of the problem. The door switch will require an adjustment in or out to eliminate the problem.

Inspect the door hold back device and the mounting hardware torque for distortion at regular intervals. All emergency exits should be inspected and operated per the operational labels on a daily basis.

step1.para: To remove the exit door hold back device use the following procedure.

step2.para: Open the exit door and locate the mounting screws on the device on the interior of the door frame.

figure.caption: Figure 173. Exit Door Hold Open Device

calloutgroup.callout1: EMERGENCY DOOR HOLD OPEN BRACKET MOUNTING SCREWS

step2.para: Loosen and remove the mounting screws.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite end of the door hold open device.
Prior to installation check the latching mechanism and lubricate as may be required.

svcsubproc.para: Each side or rear exit is equipped with a door open buzzer indicator. The buzzer assembly is operated by a plunger type switch ( Fig. 174, Item 1) located at the door opening ( Fig. 72, Item 4).

step1.para: To remove the door buzzer assembly use the following procedure.

step2.para: Locate the buzzer assembly mounting bolts.
Loosen and remove the buzzer assembly mounting screws.

calloutgroup.callout1: EMERGENCY DOOR OR WHEEL CHAIR ACCESS DOOR OPENING FRAME

step2.para: Remove the buzzer assembly, disconnect the wire harness plugs.
To remove the buzzer cover from the assembly loosen the plunger assembly mounting nut, remove plunger and cover.

svcsubproc.para: The emergency exit doors are equipped with an inside and outside latch handle mechanism. To remove the mechanism use the following procedure.

step1.para: From inside the bus, locate the lift type lever to open the latch mechanism.

step2.para: With the door in the open position loosen and remove the four mounting bolts securing the latch assembly to the door.

figure.caption: Figure 175. Door Latch Assembly (Side Emergency Exit Door Shown)

step2.para: To remove the exterior handle, locate the torque head screw in the top of the handle and one in the side of the handle.
Loosen and remove both torque head screws, remove the handle.
To remove the handle mounting plate, locate the 2 Phillip head screws on the handle mounting plate, loosen and remove screws.
Remove the handle assembly mounting plate.
Prior to installation, check the door latch mechanism and lubricate.
